data.name: Exception-PluginLabelNotDefined
data.value: '{0}.label' has not been defined in the resources file for plugin '{1}'.

data.name: Exception-PluginOnlyOneCommandPermitted
data.value: Only one shell or PowerShell command permitted.

data.name: Exception-PluginResourcesFileNotFound
data.value: Could not find resources file for plugin '{0}' at '{1}'.

data.name: Exception-PowerShellExecutionPolicyRestricted
data.value: Cannot load the XenServerPSSnapIn if the PowerShell 'ExecutionPolicy' is equal to 'Restricted'.

data.name: Exception-PowerShellNotPresent
data.value: You must have the Powershell installed to use Powershell Plugins. This can be downloaded from the Microsoft website.

data.name: Exception-PowerShellSnapInNotPresent
data.value: You must have the XenServerPSSnapIn installed to use [XenServer] PowerShell Commands. This can be found in the SDK.

data.name: Exception-SearchParseFailed
data.value: Could not parse search '{0}' for plugin '{1}'.

data.name: Exception-XenSearchFileInvalid
data.value: The file '{0}' is not a valid saved search.

data.name: Exception-XmlAttributeMissing
data.value: The required attribute '{0}' is missing from the '{1}' tag.

data.name: Message.body-extauth_in_pool_is_non_homogeneous
data.value: The external authentication service used within '{0}' is not consistent.

data.name: Message.body-extauth_init_in_host_failed
data.value:
Server '{0}' has failed to connect to the Active Directory server.
{1}

data.name: Message.body-grace_license
data.value: A grace license was issued for {0}. This was because the license server could not be reached, it is an out-of-date version, or because the host has recently been upgraded.

data.name: Message.body-ha_heartbeat_approaching_timeout
data.value: Server '{0}' is taking too long to respond to the HA networking heartbeat and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-ha_host_was_fenced
data.value: Server '{0}' was fenced, and has now successfully restarted and rejoined the pool.

data.name: Message.body-ha_network_bonding_error
data.value: One of the paths in network bond '{0}' on server '{1}' has failed. HA protection is at risk without it.

data.name: Message.body-ha_pool_drop_in_plan_exists_for-0
data.value: The failover tolerance for pool '{0}' has dropped to 0, and HA is no longer guaranteed.

data.name: Message.body-ha_pool_drop_in_plan_exists_for-1
data.value: The failover tolerance for pool '{0}' has dropped. HA is now only guaranteed for 1 host failure.

data.name: Message.body-ha_pool_drop_in_plan_exists_for-n
data.value: The failover tolerance for pool '{0}' has dropped. HA is now only guaranteed for {1} host failures.

data.name: Message.body-ha_pool_overcommitted
data.value: The maximum number of server failures tolerable in pool '{0}' has fallen below the requested value.

data.name: Message.body-ha_protected_vm_restart_failed
data.value: Virtual machine '{0}', which is protected under HA, has failed to start.

data.name: Message.body-ha_statefile_approaching_timeout
data.value: Server '{0}' is taking too long to write to the heartbeat storage and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-ha_statefile_lost
data.value: The servers in pool '{0}' cannot access the heartbeat SR. HA protection is severely impaired without it.

data.name: Message.body-ha_xapi_healthcheck_approaching_timeout
data.value: [XenServer] on server '{0}' is taking too long to respond and may fence.

data.name: Message.body-host_clock_skew_detected
data.value: The clock on server '{0}' is not synchronized with the other servers in pool '{1}'. This can lead to errors when migrating virtual machines, and also affect any performance data collected in the future.

data.name: Message.body-host_clock_went_backwards
data.value: The server clock on '{0}' has gone backwards.

data.name: Message.body-host_sync_data_failed
data.value: There was a temporary failure synchronizing performance statistics across the pool, probably because one or more servers were offline. Another synchronization attempt will be made later.

data.name: Message.body-license_does_not_support_pooling
data.value: The license on server '{0}' has expired or been changed, and no longer supports [XenServer product] Enterprise features.

data.name: Message.body-license_expires_soon
data.value: The license on host '{0}' will expire within 30 days.

data.name: Message.body-license_not_available
data.value: The requested license is not available for {0}.

data.name: Message.body-license_server_connected
data.value: The server {0} has successfully connected to the license server.

data.name: Message.body-license_server_unavailable
data.value: The server {0} has disconnected from the license server.

data.name: Message.body-license_server_unreachable
data.value: A license for {0} could not be checked-out because the license server could not be reached at the given address and port. Please check the connection details, and verify that the license server is running.

data.name: Message.body-metadata_lun_broken
data.value: Pool '{0}' is unable to access the HA metadata disk. Until access is restored changes to the pool metadata may be lost in the event of an HA failover.

data.name: Message.body-metadata_lun_healthy
data.value: Pool '{0}' successfully accessed the HA metadata disk after a previous failure and can perform a successful recovery in the event of an HA failover.

data.name: Message.body-multipath_periodic_alert
data.value: Server '{0}' has experienced a change in multipath status. Currently {1} out of {2} paths are active. See the [XenCenter] logs for the full details.

data.name: Message.body-multipath_periodic_alert_healthy
data.value: Servers in pool '{0}' have experienced a change in multipath status. Currently all paths are active. See the [XenCenter] logs for the full details.

data.name: Message.body-multipath_periodic_alert_healthy_standalone
data.value: Server '{0}' has experienced a change in multipath status. Currently all paths are active. See the [XenCenter] logs for the full details.

data.name: Message.body-multipath_periodic_alert_summary
data.value: Servers in pool '{0}' have experienced a change in multipath status. Currently the following servers have inactive paths: {1}. See the [XenCenter] logs for the full details.

data.name: Message.body-pbd_plug_failed_on_server_start
data.value: A storage repository could not be attached when server '{0}' started.

data.name: Message.body-pool_master_transition
data.value: Server '{0}' is now the master of pool '{1}'.

data.name: Message.body-vbd_qos_failed
data.value: Quality of Service settings for disk '{0}' on virtual machine '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vcpu_qos_failed
data.value: Quality of Service settings for VCPU '{0}' on virtual machine '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vdi_cbt_metadata_inconsistent
data.value: Changed block tracking has been disabled for virtual disk {0} due to inconsistent metadata. To continue using changed block tracking with this virtual disk, you will need to do the backup setup again, including re-enabling changed block tracking, taking a snapshot and backing it up.

data.name: Message.body-vdi_cbt_resize_failed
data.value: Changed block tracking has been disabled for virtual disk {0} due to a resizing failure. To continue using changed block tracking with this virtual disk, you will need to do the backup setup again, including re-enabling changed block tracking, taking a snapshot and backing it up.

data.name: Message.body-vdi_cbt_snapshot_failed
data.value: Changed block tracking has been disabled for virtual disk {0} due to a snapshot failure. To continue using changed block tracking with this virtual disk, you will need to do the backup setup again, including re-enabling changed block tracking, taking a snapshot and backing it up.

data.name: Message.body-vif_qos_failed
data.value: Quality of Service settings for network interface '{0}' on virtual machine '{1}' could not be obeyed.

data.name: Message.body-vm_shutdown
data.value: Virtual machine '{0}' has been shut down.

data.name: Message.body-vm_uncooperative
data.value: Virtual machine '{0}' did not reduce its memory usage when requested.

data.name: Message.body-vmss_license_error
data.value: The [XenServer] license you are using does not allow you to use the Scheduled Snapshots feature.

data.name: Message.body-vmss_snapshot_failed
data.value: The snapshot schedule '{0}' failed because a snapshot could not be created.

data.name: Message.body-vmss_snapshot_lock_failed
data.value: Unable to create snapshots at this time because a scheduled snapshot operation is already in progress in this pool. Only one scheduled snapshot operation can run at a time in the same pool. Please check that the snapshot schedules in this pool do not clash.

data.name: Message.body-vmss_snapshot_missed_event
data.value: Unable to create snapshots at this time because the scheduled snapshot operation for this policy is already in progress. Please try again later.

data.name: Message.body-wlb_consultation_failed
data.value: Pool '{0}' failed to retrieve placement recommendations from WLB for '{1}'.

data.name: Message.body-wlb_optimization_alert
data.value: WLB reports that the pool '{0}' is in need of optimization. The pool optimization mode is set to '{1}' and the severity of the alert is '{2}'.

data.name: Message.name-extauth_in_pool_is_non_homogeneous
data.value: Authentication method is not consistent across the Pool

data.name: Message.name-extauth_init_in_host_failed
data.value: Active Directory authorization is not available

data.name: Message.name-license_server_unreachable
data.value: The license server could not be reached.

data.name: Message.name-metadata_lun_broken
data.value: Lost access to HA metadata disk

data.name: Message.name-metadata_lun_healthy
data.value: Restored access to HA metadata disk

data.name: Message.name-pbd_plug_failed_on_server_start
data.value: Failed to attach storage on server start

data.name: Message.name-vdi_cbt_metadata_inconsistent
data.value: Changed block tracking disabled due to inconsistent metadata

data.name: Message.name-vdi_cbt_resize_failed
data.value: Changed block tracking disabled due to a virtual disk resizing failure

data.name: Message.name-vdi_cbt_snapshot_failed
data.value: Changed block tracking disabled due to a snapshot failure

data.name: Message.name-vmss_license_error
data.value: Snapshot schedule failed: insufficient license for Scheduled snapshots

data.name: Role.pool-admin.Description
data.value:
Pool Admins have full access to all [XenServer] features and settings. They can access the [XenServer] console and manage the roles of other users.
- No restrictions - Role and user management - Access to [XenServer] console

data.name: Role.pool-operator.Description
data.value:
Pool Operators manage pool-wide resources, including setting up storage, managing patches and creating resource pools.
- Configure pool resources - Full access to High Availability (HA), Workload Balancing (WLB) and patch management features - No access to role management

data.name: Role.read-only.Description
data.value:
With a Read Only role, the user has basic read access. They can connect to the server and view its contents, but will be unable to issue commands or alter any settings.
- Read access only

data.name: Role.vm-admin.Description
data.value:
VM Admins can manage VMs and Templates and can access the storage necessary to complete these tasks. This role relies on [XenServer] to choose where to run each VM, and on templates to provide values for dynamic memory control (DMC) and Home Server settings.
- Manage VMs and Templates - No access to dynamic memory control features - No access to VM snapshot features - Cannot set Home Server or choose where to run workloads

data.name: Role.vm-operator.Description
data.value:
VM Operators are granted access to use the VMs within the resource pool. They can interact with VM consoles, and can start or stop VMs when there are sufficient server resources available.
- Full access to VM consoles - Basic VM lifecycle control - Cannot alter VM properties or server resources

data.name: Role.vm-power-admin.Description
data.value:
VM Power Admins have full access to VM and Template management. They can choose where to start VMs, and can use the dynamic memory control and VM snapshot features.
- Manages VMs and Templates - Full access to dynamic memory control features - Full access to VM snapshot features - Can set Home Server and choose where to run workloads

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Demo Linux VM
data.value: This template can be used to create a Linux VM with a built-in Linux distribution for testing and demonstration purposes. It is not recommended for production use.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Other install media
data.value: If the operating system you plan to use is not listed, you may be able to install it by selecting this template. We recommend that only advanced users attempt to use this template, and you should note that our products have been tested running only the supported distributions and specific versions covered by the standard supplied templates.

data.name: VM.TemplateDescription-Xen API SDK
data.value: This template may be used to install the [XenServer] Software Development Kit (SDK) API VM.
